multiplechoiceresponse.label: An economics student doing her dissertation on economic development in these two countries has noticed that the rate of capital depreciation in Hamsterville is twice as high as in Gerbilalia.
multiplechoiceresponse.lable: Which of the following best describes a criticism of using GDP to compare these two countries that we can infer based on this information?

choicegroup.choice: One country likely has higher levels of pollution
There is no criticism of GDP as a measure of output here because these two countries have identical GDP
One country has highly unequal distribution of income
